DOC.brief_summary: This study investigate effect commercially-available dairy ( 1 % cow 's milk yogurt beverage ) non-dairy alternative ( almond soy beverage ) satiety post-meal blood glucose . Each participant receive every treatment crossover design study .
DOC.brief_title: The Effect Dairy Non-dairy Alternatives Satiety Post-meal Glycemia Healthy Young Adults
DOC.detailed_description: Regular consumption dairy associate well body composition low incidence type 2 diabetes obesity . This may due dairy 's ability increase satiety decrease post-prandial glycemia . However , clinical study investigate isolated dairy protein ( whey casein ) effect whole dairy product remain unclear . Additionally , non-dairy alternative become popular interest see elicit similar benefit dairy . Therefore , study test effect commercially-available dairy non-dairy beverage consume cereal breakfast time . Thirty healthy young male female ( 20-30 year , BMI 20.0-24.9 kg/m2 ) recruit randomize , unblinded , crossover study . Participants fast overnight , baseline consume 250 mL 1 % milk , soy beverage , almond beverage , yogurt beverage , water 54 g Cheerios cereal . At 0 ( baseline ) , 15 , 30 , 45 , 60 , 75 , 90 , 120 minute ( pre-meal period ) 140 , 170 minute ( post-meal period ) blood collect glucose analysis subjective appetite rating complete . Insulin analyze every 30 minute last two timepoints . Between 120-140 minute , ad libitum lunch provide assess food intake .
DOC.criteria: Healthy BMI ( 20.0 24.9 kg/m2 ) Females regular monthly menstrual cycle Diabetes Fasting blood glucose high 5.8 mmol/L Pregnancy Medications Smoking Lactose intolerance allergy milk , soy , almonds Elite athlete Those try lose gain weight Breakfast skipper energyrestricted diet Score equal high 11 Eating Habits Questionnaire
